description: This seminar examines development from birth to age three.  Topics
include prenatal development, birth and the newborn, physical and motor development, caregiver
relationships, infant mental health, cognition, and language development.  Students explore
questions such as: How long-lasting are the effects of early experiences?  How do diverse cultural
contexts influence early development? Course format is primarily discussion-based and includes
community-based experiential learning projects. Offered annually. Also counts toward applied
linguistics concentration. Prerequisites: PSYCH 230 and PSYCH 241 or permission of instructor.
